alert.note: Alert for Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:34PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Dona Ana, central Hudspeth and El Paso Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 633 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Allamoore. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Tornillo, Sierra Blanca, Fabens, Clint, Horizon City, Chaparral, Anthony, Santa Teresa, Fort Quitman, Fort Hancock, Sunland Park, Esperanza, Indian Cliffs Ranch and Canutillo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 160 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 18, and between mile markers 20 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
